member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.AlternativeFrame.Preload(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Preloads a page of the specified source page type.
member.remarks: Allows to preload a page before user navigates to it, so if it does get navigated to - shows up quickly. If another page gets navigated to - the preloaded page will be released or cached depending on its NavigationCacheMode property.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.AlternativeFrame.UnloadPreloaded(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Unloads the preloaded page of a given type and parameter.
member.remarks: A page might have been preloaded in the anticipation of the user navigating to it, then a state change might invalidate or reduce the possibility of a navigation request and it might be worth unloading the preloaded page to release resources that it consumed. The preloaded page will be released or cached depending on its NavigationCacheMode property.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.AlternativeFrame.UnloadAllPreloaded
member.summary: Unloads all preloaded pages.
member.remarks: Pages might have been preloaded in the anticipation of the user navigating to them, then a state change might invalidate or reduce the possibility of a navigation request and it might be worth unloading the preloaded pages to release resources that they consumed. The preloaded page will be released or cached depending on its NavigationCacheMode property.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.AlternativeFrame.SetNavigationState(System.String)
member.summary: Reads and restores the navigation history of a Frame from a provided serialization string.
member.param: The serialization string that supplies the restore point for navigation history.

member.summary: Serializes the Frame navigation history into a string.

In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in your app. Override this method to influence the default post-template logic of a class.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.FrameCache
member.summary: Manages instantiation, retrieval and caching of AlternativePage instances used in AlternativeFrame in a manner similar to the original Frame class in the framework. AlternativeFrame should always get page instances by calling FrameCache.Get() when navigating to a page or preloading one and store a page by calling FrameCache.Store() when navigating away from it. FrameCache decides whether a page should actually be cached when calling Store() or whether to ignore the call.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.FrameCache.Get(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the page of specified type. If one is already cached - it removes it from the cache and returns it. If one isn't cached - it returns a new instance.
member.remarks: There is no guarantee of returning a specific page from the cache if there are multiple pages of the same type stored.
member.returns: An AlternativePage of a given type.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.FrameCache.Store(WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.AlternativePage)
member.summary: Stores the specified page in cache.
member.remarks: Multiple pages of same type may be stored.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.NavigationCacheMode
member.summary: Specifies how the page is cached when used within a frame.
member.remarks:
You use the NavigationCacheMode enumeration when setting the NavigationCacheMode property of the class. You specify whether a new instance of the page is created for each visit to the page or whether a previously constructed instance of the page that has been saved in the cache is used for each visit.
The default value for the NavigationCacheMode property is Disabled. Set the NavigationCacheMode property to Enabled or Required when a new instance of the page is not essential for each visit. By using a cached instance of the page, you can improve the performance of your application and reduce the load on your server. Set the NavigationCacheMode property to Disabled if a new instance must be created for each visit. For example, you should not cache a page that displays information that is unique to each customer.
The OnNavigatedTo method is called for each request, even when the page is retrieved from the cache. You should include in this method code that must be executed for each request rather than placing that code in the Page constructor.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.NavigationCacheMode.Disabled
member.summary: The page is never cached and a new instance of the page is created on each visit.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.NavigationCacheMode.Required
member.summary: The page is cached and the cached instance is reused for every visit regardless of the cache size for the frame.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.NavigationCacheMode.Enabled
member.summary: The page is cached, but the cached instance is discarded when the size of the cache for the frame is exceeded.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks
member.summary: Defines basic formats accepted by TextBox Text.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.Any
member.summary: Any content is valid.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.NonEmpty
member.summary: Field value can't be empty.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.Numeric
member.summary: Field value needs to be numeric (parse to a double).

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.SpecificLength
member.summary: Field value needs to be as long as MaxLength.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.MinLength
member.summary: Field value needs to be at least as long as FieldValidationExtensions.MinLength.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.MatchesRegexPattern
member.summary: Field value needs to match Pattern treated as a regular expression.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.EqualsPattern
member.summary: Field value equals value specified by the FieldValidationExtensions.Pattern property.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.IncludesLowercase
member.summary: The field value needs to include lowercase characters.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.IncludesUppercase
member.summary: The field value needs to include uppercase characters.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.IncludesDigits
member.summary: The field value needs to include digits.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.IncludesSymbol
member.summary: The field value needs to include symbols (non-alphabetic, non-numeric, non-space characters - includes punctuation characters).

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.NoDoubles
member.summary: The field value can't include doubled substrings (e.g. "BB" or "ABAB").

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.NonEmptyNumeric
member.summary: Field value needs to be numeric (parse to a double) and non-empty.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ValidationChecks.IsStrongPassword
member.summary: The field value needs to be a strong password - match minimum length requirement, include upper and lowercase characters, numbers, symbols and can't have doubled substrings.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ListBoxItemExtensions

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ListBoxItemExtensions.GetIsEnabled(Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the IsEnabled property. This dependency property indicates whether the first ListBoxItem found in ancestors is enabled.
member.remarks: Note that the IsEnabled property is to be used on an element inside of a ListBox and not the ListBoxItem itself. Setting this property will update the IsEnabled property of the ListBoxItem making it easier to disable selection of ListBoxItems in the databound collection scenarios.

member.remarks: Note that the IsEnabled property is to be used on an element inside of a ListBox and not the ListBoxItem itself. Setting this property will update the IsEnabled property of the ListBoxItem making it easier to disable selection of ListBoxItems in the databound collection scenarios.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ListBoxItemExtensions.GetIsSelected(Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the IsSelected property. This dependency property indicates whether the first ListBoxItem found in ancestors is selected.
member.remarks: Note that the IsSelected property is to be used on an element inside of a ListBox and not the ListBoxItem itself. Setting this property will update the IsSelected property of the ListBoxItem making it easier to disable selection of ListBoxItems in the databound collection scenarios.

member.exception: This method can only be invoked from UI thread.

member.summary: Gets or sets the AnimateOnLoaded property. This dependency property indicates whether the cascading transitions should start when the control loads.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Text property. This dependency property indicates the Text to display.

member.summary: Gets or sets the TextBlockTemplate property. This dependency property indicates the template of a TextBlock to use for the animated letter TextBlocks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the StartDelay property. This dependency property indicates the delay in ms after which the cascading animation should start.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeIn
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeIn property. This dependency property indicates whether the letters should cascade in.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeOut
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeOut property. This dependency property indicates whether the letters should cascade out.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.HoldDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the HoldDuration property. This dependency property indicates the duration that the letters should stay between cascades.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.HoldDurationString
member.summary: Gets or sets the HoldDurationString property. This dependency property indicates the interval of the cascade out animation as a string.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeInDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeInDuration property. This dependency property indicates the duration that each of the letters should spend cascading in.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeInDurationString
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeInDurationString property. This dependency property indicates the duration of the cascade in animation as a string.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeOutDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeOutDuration property. This dependency property indicates the duration that each of the letters should spend cascading out.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeOutDurationString
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeOutDurationString property. This dependency property indicates the duration of the cascade out animation as a string.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeInterval property. This dependency property indicates the interval between when each letter starts cascading.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeIntervalString
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeIntervalString property. This dependency property indicates the interval of the cascade out animation as a string.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeInEasingFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeInEasingFunction property. This dependency property indicates the easing function to use in the cascade in transition.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.CascadeOutEasingFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the CascadeOutEasingFunction property. This dependency property indicates the easing function to use in the cascade out transition.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.FromVerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the FromVerticalOffset property. This dependency property indicates the offset from which the letters cascade in.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.ToVerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the ToVerticalOffset property. This dependency property indicates the offset to which the letters cascade out.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.FromRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the FromRotation property. This dependency property indicates the rotation from which the letters will cascade in.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.ToRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the ToRotation property. This dependency property indicates the rotation to which the letters cascade out.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.UseFade
member.summary: Gets or sets the UseFade property. This dependency property indicates whether the letters should fade in and out during cascading transitions.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.UseRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the UseRotation property. This dependency property indicates whether the letters should rotate around Y axis when cascading.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CascadingTextBlock.FadeInEasingFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the FadeInEasingFunction property. This dependency property indicates the easing function to use for fading in the cascade in transition.

member.summary: Gets or sets the FadeOutEasingFunction property. This dependency property indicates the easing function to use for fading out the cascade out transition.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.UIElementAnimationExtensions.FadeIn(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Fades the element in using the FadeInThemeAnimation.
member.remarks:
Opacity property of the element is not affected.
The duration of the visible animation itself is not affected by the duration parameter. It merely indicates how long the Storyboard will run.
If FadeOutThemeAnimation was not used on the element before - nothing will happen.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.UIElementAnimationExtensions.FadeOut(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Fades the element out using the FadeOutThemeAnimation.
member.remarks:
Opacity property of the element is not affected.
The duration of the visible animation itself is not affected by the duration parameter. It merely indicates how long the Storyboard will run.
If FadeOutThemeAnimation was already run before and FadeInThemeAnimation was not run after that - nothing will happen.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.UIElementAnimationExtensions.FadeInCustom(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.EasingFunctionBase,System.Double)
member.summary: Fades the element in using a custom DoubleAnimation of the Opacity property.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.UIElementAnimationExtensions.FadeOutCustom(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.EasingFunctionBase)
member.summary: Fades the element out using a custom DoubleAnimation of the Opacity property.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.ImageToggleButton.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the Stretch property. This dependency property indicates how an Image should be stretched to fill the button.
member.remarks: A value of the Stretch enumeration specifies how the source image is applied if the Height and Width of the ImageToggleButton are specified and are different than the source image's height and width. The default value is None.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomAppBar
member.summary: AppBar control replacement. To be used anywhere in the visual tree. The standard AppBar does not do the slide transitions when not placed in the Page.Bottom/Top-AppBar properties, which makes it less useful when used e.g. with the AlternativeFrame control. There are also other cases when it just makes sense to put it elsewhere on screen. Contains improvements such properties that lock it in opened or closed states, apart from simply giving you the source code you can tweak to your liking.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the rows or columns that are resized by a WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter control.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeBehavior.BasedOnAlignment
member.summary: Space is redistributed based on the value of the Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment and Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment properties.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeBehavior.CurrentAndNext
member.summary: For a horizontal WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter, space is redistributed between the row that is specified for the WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter and the next row that is below it. For a vertical WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter, space is redistributed between the column that is specified for the WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter and the next column that is to the right.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeBehavior.PreviousAndCurrent
member.summary: For a horizontal WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter, space is redistributed between the row that is specified for the WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter and the next row that is above it. For a vertical WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter, space is redistributed between the column that is specified for the WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter and the next column that is to the left.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeBehavior.PreviousAndNext
member.summary: For a horizontal WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter, space is redistributed between the rows that are above and below the row that is specified for the WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter. For a vertical WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter, space is redistributed between the columns that are to the left and right of the column that is specified for the WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeDirection
member.summary: Specifies whether a WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter control redistributes space between rows or between columns.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeDirection.Auto
member.summary: Space is redistributed based on the values of the Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment, Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment, Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.ActualWidth, and Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.ActualHeight properties of the WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeDirection.Columns
member.summary: Space is redistributed between columns.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.GridResizeDirection.Rows
member.summary: Space is redistributed between rows.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.CustomGridSplitter
member.summary: A control similar to the GridSplitter seen in WPF and Sivlerlight.

member.summary: Invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call ApplyTemplate. In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in your app. Override this method to influence the default post-template logic of a class.

member.name: P:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.ImageButton.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the Stretch property. This dependency property indicates how an Image should be stretched to fill the button.
member.remarks: A value of the Stretch enumeration specifies how the source image is applied if the Height and Width of the ImageButton are specified and are different than the source image's height and width. The default value is None.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.Extensions.ListViewItemExtensions.GetIsEnabled(Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)

member.remarks: Note that the IsEnabled property is to be used on an element inside of a ListView and not the ListViewItem itself. member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.InteractionHelper
member.summary: The InteractionHelper provides controls with support for all of the common interactions like mouse movement, mouse clicks, key presses, etc., and also incorporates proper event semantics when the control is disabled.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInMilliseconds
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are temporally local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.). 500 milliseconds is the default double click value on Windows. This value would ideally be pulled form the system settings.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInPixelsSquared
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are spatially local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.) in pixels squared. We use pixels squared so that we can compare to the distance delta without taking a square root.

member.name: F:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.InteractionHelper._updateVisualState
member.summary: Reference used to call UpdateVisualState on the base class.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.InteractionHelper.#ctor(Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InteractionHelper class.

member.name: M:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
member.remarks: UpdateVisualState works differently than the rest of the injected functionality. Most of the other events are overridden by the calling class which calls Allow, does what it wants, and then calls Base. UpdateVisualState is the opposite because a number of the methods in InteractionHelper need to trigger it in the calling class. We do this using the IUpdateVisualState internal interface.

member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Controls.OrientedSize
member.summary: The OrientedSize structure is used to abstract the growth direction from the layout algorithms of WrapPanel. When the growth direction is oriented horizontally (ex: the next element is arranged on the side of the previous element), then the Width grows directly with the placement of elements and Height grows indirectly with the size of the largest element in the row. When the orientation is reversed, so is the directional growth with respect to Width and Height.

member.summary: The size dimension that grows directly with layout placement.

member.summary: The size dimension that grows indirectly with the maximum value of the layout row or column.

member.summary: Contains extensions for an IBuffer interface in the context of a WriteableBitmap, which exposes one to access its pixels.

member.summary: Gets the pixels access wrapper for a PixelBuffer property of a WriteableBitmap.

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Imaging.IBufferExtensions.PixelBufferInfo
member.summary: Gives access to the pixels of a WriteableBitmap given an IBuffer exposed by Pixels property.
member.remarks: Note that creating this object copies the pixels buffer into the Bytes byte array for quick pixel access and the array needs to be copied back to the pixels buffer to update the bitmap with a call to UpdateFromBytes(). This is acceptable for convenience and possibly best for performance in some scenarios, but it does add some upfront overhead as well overhead to update the bitmap at the end. This is only a theory and for better performance it might be good to test different approaches. The goal of this approach is code simplicity. For best performance using native code and/or DirectX is recommended.

member.summary: Returns the maximum difference between any of the R/G/B/A components of a color at given index and the one passed as parameter.
member.returns: E.g. for 0x01010101 and 0x00010203 returns 0x01.

member.param: The pixel buffer returned by WriteableBitmap.PixelBuffer.

member.summary: Updates the associated pixel buffer from bytes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the containing an ARGB format pixel at index i in the buffer.
member.value: The containing an ARGB format pixel.
member.remarks: To access a pixel at position x,y you need to get pixels[wb.PixelWidth * y + x].

member.name: T:WinRTXamlToolkit.Tools.BackgroundTimer
member.summary: A timer that raises the Tick events on a background thread, similar to ThreadPoolTimer, but with API compatible with DispatcherTimer.
member.remarks: It was written in response to this SO question: Controlled non UI timer in metro app (.NET) (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10493253/controlled-non-ui-timer-in-metro-app-net). The purpose was to have ticks on a background thread and have the same API as the DispatcherTimer. It also has an option to self adjust a bit to have an average frequency closer to what you would expect given the configured Interval. That said I was not aware of the ThreadPoolTimer, so it is possible it makes more sense to use that one. It is a bit strange that the two timers we get have different APIs though, so perhaps that is one case where using the BackgroundTimer makes a little bit of sense.

member.summary: Stops the BackgroundTimer - non blocking.
